official-title.#text: To amend the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to specify that privilege and confidentiality are maintained when information is shared by certain nondepository covered persons with Federal and State financial regulators, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives July 29, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Examination and Supervisory Privilege Parity Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Examination and Supervisory Privilege Parity Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1024(b)(3) of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010

header.#text: Privilege of information shared by certain nondepository covered persons

quote.#text: regulators and the State bank regulatory authorities
regulators, the State bank regulatory authorities, and the State agencies that licence, supervise, or examine the offering of consumer financial products or services

The sharing of information with such regulators, authorities, and agencies shall not be construed as waiving, destroying, or otherwise affecting any privilege or confidentiality such person may claim with respect to such information under Federal or State law as to any person or entity other than such Bureau, agency, supervisor, or authority.

text.#text: by adding at the end the following:

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5062 EH: Examination and Supervisory Privilege Parity Act of 2014

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
